refnamediv.refpurpose: Functions for transfering data via the X selection mechanism

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis:
#include <gdk/gdk.h>
typedef GdkSelection; typedef GdkSelectionType; typedef GdkTarget; #define GDK_SELECTION_PRIMARY #define GDK_SELECTION_SECONDARY #define GDK_SELECTION_CLIPBOARD #define GDK_TARGET_BITMAP #define GDK_TARGET_COLORMAP #define GDK_TARGET_DRAWABLE #define GDK_TARGET_PIXMAP #define GDK_TARGET_STRING #define GDK_SELECTION_TYPE_ATOM #define GDK_SELECTION_TYPE_BITMAP #define GDK_SELECTION_TYPE_COLORMAP #define GDK_SELECTION_TYPE_DRAWABLE #define GDK_SELECTION_TYPE_INTEGER #define GDK_SELECTION_TYPE_PIXMAP #define GDK_SELECTION_TYPE_WINDOW #define GDK_SELECTION_TYPE_STRING gboolean gdk_selection_owner_set (GdkWindow *owner, GdkAtom selection, guint32 time_, gboolean send_event); gboolean gdk_selection_owner_set_for_display (GdkDisplay *display, GdkWindow *owner, GdkAtom selection, guint32 time_, gboolean send_event); GdkWindow* gdk_selection_owner_get (GdkAtom selection); GdkWindow* gdk_selection_owner_get_for_display (GdkDisplay *display, GdkAtom selection); void gdk_selection_convert (GdkWindow *requestor, GdkAtom selection, GdkAtom target, guint32 time_); gboolean gdk_selection_property_get (GdkWindow *requestor, guchar **data, GdkAtom *prop_type, gint *prop_format); void gdk_selection_send_notify (guint32 requestor, GdkAtom selection, GdkAtom target, GdkAtom property, guint32 time_); void gdk_selection_send_notify_for_display (GdkDisplay *display, guint32 requestor, GdkAtom selection, GdkAtom target, GdkAtom property, guint32 time_);

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The X selection mechanism provides a way to transfer arbitrary chunks of data between programs. A selection is a essentially a named clipboard, identified by a string interned as a GdkAtom. By claiming ownership of a selection, an application indicates that it will be responsible for supplying its contents. The most common selections are PRIMARY and CLIPBOARD.

The contents of a selection can be represented in a number of formats, called targets. Each target is identified by an atom. A list of all possible targets supported by the selection owner can be retrieved by requesting the special target TARGETS. When a selection is retrieved, the data is accompanied by a type (an atom), and a format (an integer, representing the number of bits per item). See Properties and Atoms for more information.

The functions in this section only contain the lowlevel parts of the selection protocol. A considerably more complicated implementation is needed on top of this. GTK+ contains such an implementation in the functions in gtkselection.h and programmers should use those functions instead of the ones presented here. If you plan to implement selection handling directly on top of the functions here, you should refer to the X Inter-client Communication Conventions Manual (ICCCM).

refsect2.title: GdkSelection

warning.para: GdkSelection is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: The GdkSelection enumeration contains predefined atom values for several common selections.

refsect2.title: GdkSelectionType

warning.para: GdkSelectionType is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: The GdkSelectionType enumeration contains predefined atom values used to represent the types of data transferred in response to a request for a target. See the ICCCM for details about what data should be transferred for each of these types. Other atoms can be used, and the recommended practice for GTK+ is to to use mime types for this purpose. However, supporting these types may be useful for compatibility with older programs.

refsect2.title: GdkTarget

warning.para: GdkTarget is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: The GdkTarget enumeration contains predefined atom values which are used to describe possible targets for a selection. Other atoms can be used, and the recommended practice for GTK+ is to to use mime types for this purpose. However, supporting these types may be useful for compatibility with older programs.

refsect2.title: GDK_SELECTION_PRIMARY
refsect2.para: A GdkAtom representing the PRIMARY selection.

refsect2.title: GDK_SELECTION_SECONDARY
refsect2.para: A GdkAtom representing the SECONDARY selection.

refsect2.title: GDK_SELECTION_CLIPBOARD
refsect2.para: A GdkAtom representing the CLIPBOARD selection.

refsect2.title: GDK_TARGET_BITMAP
refsect2.para: A GdkAtom representing the BITMAP selection target.

refsect2.title: GDK_TARGET_COLORMAP
refsect2.para: A GdkAtom representing the COLORMAP selection target.

refsect2.title: GDK_TARGET_DRAWABLE
refsect2.para: A GdkAtom representing the DRAWABLE selection target.

refsect2.title: GDK_TARGET_PIXMAP
refsect2.para: A GdkAtom representing the PIXMAP selection target.

refsect2.title: GDK_TARGET_STRING
refsect2.para: A GdkAtom representing the STRING selection target.

refsect2.title: GDK_SELECTION_TYPE_ATOM
refsect2.para: A GdkAtom representing the ATOM selection type.

refsect2.title: GDK_SELECTION_TYPE_BITMAP
refsect2.para: A GdkAtom representing the BITMAP selection type.

refsect2.title: GDK_SELECTION_TYPE_COLORMAP
refsect2.para: A GdkAtom representing the COLORMAP selection type.

refsect2.title: GDK_SELECTION_TYPE_DRAWABLE
refsect2.para: A GdkAtom representing the DRAWABLE selection type.

refsect2.title: GDK_SELECTION_TYPE_INTEGER
refsect2.para: A GdkAtom representing the INTEGER selection type.

refsect2.title: GDK_SELECTION_TYPE_PIXMAP
refsect2.para: A GdkAtom representing the PIXMAP selection type.

refsect2.title: GDK_SELECTION_TYPE_WINDOW
refsect2.para: A GdkAtom representing the WINDOW selection type.

refsect2.title: GDK_SELECTION_TYPE_STRING
refsect2.para: A GdkAtom representing the STRING selection type.

refsect2.title: gdk_selection_owner_set ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gdk_selection_owner_set (GdkWindow *owner, GdkAtom selection, guint32 time_, gboolean send_event);
refsect2.para: Sets the owner of the given selection.

listitem.simpara: a GdkWindow or NULL to indicate that the the owner for the given should be unset.
an atom identifying a selection.
timestamp to use when setting the selection. If this is older than the timestamp given last time the owner was set for the given selection, the request will be ignored.
if TRUE, and the new owner is different from the current owner, the current owner will be sent a SelectionClear event.
TRUE if the selection owner was successfully changed to owner, otherwise FALSE.

refsect2.title: gdk_selection_owner_set_for_display ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gdk_selection_owner_set_for_display (GdkDisplay *display, GdkWindow *owner, GdkAtom selection, guint32 time_, gboolean send_event);
refsect2.para: Sets the GdkWindow owner as the current owner of the selection selection.

listitem.simpara: the GdkDisplay.
a GdkWindow or NULL to indicate that the the owner for the given should be unset.
an atom identifying a selection.
timestamp to use when setting the selection. If this is older than the timestamp given last time the owner was set for the given selection, the request will be ignored.
if TRUE, and the new owner is different from the current owner, the current owner will be sent a SelectionClear event.
TRUE if the selection owner was successfully changed to owner, otherwise FALSE.

refsect2.para: Since 2.2

refsect2.title: gdk_selection_owner_get ()
refsect2.para: Determines the owner of the given selection.

listitem.simpara: an atom indentifying a selection.

if there is a selection owner for this window, and it is a window known to the current process, the GdkWindow that owns the selection, otherwise NULL. Note that the return value may be owned by a different process if a foreign window was previously created for that window, but a new foreign window will never be created by this call.

refsect2.title: gdk_selection_owner_get_for_display ()
refsect2.para: Determine the owner of the given selection.
Note that the return value may be owned by a different process if a foreign window was previously created for that window, but a new foreign window will never be created by this call.

listitem.simpara: a GdkDisplay.
an atom indentifying a selection.
if there is a selection owner for this window, and it is a window known to the current process, the GdkWindow that owns the selection, otherwise NULL.

refsect2.para: Since 2.2

refsect2.title: gdk_selection_convert ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gdk_selection_convert (GdkWindow *requestor, GdkAtom selection, GdkAtom target, guint32 time_);
refsect2.para: Retrieves the contents of a selection in a given form.

listitem.simpara: a GdkWindow.
an atom identifying the selection to get the contents of.
the form in which to retrieve the selection.
the timestamp to use when retrieving the selection. The selection owner may refuse the request if it did not own the selection at the time indicated by the timestamp.

refsect2.title: gdk_selection_property_get ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves selection data that was stored by the selection data in response to a call to gdk_selection_convert(). This function will not be used by applications, who should use the GtkClipboard API instead.

listitem.simpara: the window on which the data is stored

location to store a pointer to the retrieved data. If the retrieval failed, NULL we be stored here, otherwise, it will be non-NULL and the returned data should be freed with g_free() when you are finished using it. The length of the allocated memory is one more than the the length of the returned data, and the final byte will always be zero, to ensure nul-termination of strings.
location to store the type of the property.
location to store the format of the property.
the length of the retrieved data.

refsect2.title: gdk_selection_send_notify ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gdk_selection_send_notify (guint32 requestor, GdkAtom selection, GdkAtom target, GdkAtom property, guint32 time_);
refsect2.para: Sends a response to SelectionRequest event.

listitem.simpara: window to which to deliver response.
selection that was requested.
target that was selected.
property in which the selection owner stored the data, or GDK_NONE to indicate that the request was rejected.
timestamp.

refsect2.title: gdk_selection_send_notify_for_display ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gdk_selection_send_notify_for_display (GdkDisplay *display, guint32 requestor, GdkAtom selection, GdkAtom target, GdkAtom property, guint32 time_);
refsect2.para: Send a response to SelectionRequest event.

listitem.simpara: the GdkDisplay where requestor is realized
window to which to deliver response.
selection that was requested.
target that was selected.
property in which the selection owner stored the data, or GDK_NONE to indicate that the request was rejected.
timestamp.

refsect2.para: Since 2.2
